intro: Sida montana var. intermedia, commonly known as Mexican mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial species that typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant features broad, lobed leaves and produces showy, pink or purple flowers. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants like cotton and hibiscus. Sida montana var. intermedia is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in poor, sandy conditions.
